description: An impressive video has emerged from east China of a man commanding five dogs to walk together in unison, march like soldiers and do everything he says, including barking mathematics.
title: Pet owner in China caught giving his five poodles military training on the streets
title_page: Pet owner in China caught giving his five poodles military training on the streets  | Daily Mail Online
text:
Training a dog can take a long time – up to four years in some cases – now imagine what it’s like to train five, not just to sit, but to do a number of tricks in unison, even mathematics.
An impressive video has emerged from China of a man doing exactly that. His poodles walk together, marching like soldiers and doing everything he says on command, reports the People’s Daily Online.
Mr Dai from Qingdao, Shandong Province was filmed on the street by a passerby. His pet poodles followed his order to heel, sit and stands on their hind legs at exactly the same time.
The five dogs cautiously watch their owner (left). On command they sit on their hind legs looking up (right)
Attention: These poodles have been military trained to do everything their owner says on command in China
Speaking to China Central Television, Mr Dai said: ‘The highest level is not for a human to train dogs, but for dogs to train humans.
‘For example, if they want to go to the toilet, though they can’t talk, they have certain body languages to communicate. If you fail to understand then it is harder to communicate with the pets,’ he said.
The 40-second amateur footage shows Mr Dai walking with his five dogs. They all stop and sit at the same time, then they all put both of their front paws up towards him.
He moves to the side and they all lie down. After another command they stand up again.
About ten seconds after the final command, the bigger dog in front walks off on his hind legs and the other four follow.
During the video Mr Dai is heard saying: ‘Attention, stop, forward, and lie down.’
Mr Dai started serious training after one of the dogs - named Duo Bi - behaved really badly when he brought it to visit a friend.
A naughty Duo Bi jumped up onto the table and knocked over his friend’s flask, spilling the contents inside.
This made Mr Dai feel like he needed to properly train his pets well from then on.
Impressive: As the others follow, the front bigger dog walks on his hind legs after Mar Dao's command
When he got more poodles - all the same colour as Duo Bi - he started teaching them hard-core training drills regularly.
These included teaching them to walk on their hind legs, lying down, and even doing mathematics.
When he asks Duo Bi, ‘what’s two times three?’ the four-year-old pet barks six times.
Then he asks, ‘what’s ten minus two?’ amazingly the pooch barks eight times.
He makes sure at all times that the bigger dog stays at the top of the line moving closer to the other four, before commanding him it to lead the group away.
